com.azure.storage.blob

Class ContainerAsyncClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.azure.storage.blob.ContainerAsyncClient

  • public final class ContainerAsyncClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Client to a container. It may only be instantiated through a ContainerClientBuilder or via the method BlobServiceAsyncClient.getContainerAsyncClient(String). This class does not hold any state about a particular blob but is instead a convenient way of sending off appropriate requests to the resource on the service. It may also be used to construct URLs to blobs.

    This client contains operations on a container. Operations on a blob are available on BlobAsyncClient through ContainerAsyncClient.getBlobAsyncClient(String), and operations on the service are available on BlobServiceAsyncClient.

    Please refer to the Azure Docs for more information on containers.

    Note this client is an async client that returns reactive responses from Spring Reactor Core project (https://projectreactor.io/). Calling the methods in this client will NOT start the actual network operation, until .subscribe() is called on the reactive response. You can simply convert one of these responses to a CompletableFuture object through Mono.toFuture().

    • Method Detail

      • getBlockBlobAsyncClient

        public BlockBlobAsyncClient getBlockBlobAsyncClient(java.lang.String blobName)
        Creates a new BlockBlobAsyncClient object by concatenating the blobName to the end of ContainerAsyncClient's URL. The new BlockBlobAsyncClient uses the same request policy pipeline as the ContainerAsyncClient. To change the pipeline, create the BlockBlobAsyncClient and then call its WithPipeline method passing in the desired pipeline object. Or, call this package's NewBlockBlobAsyncClient instead of calling this object's NewBlockBlobAsyncClient method.
        Parameters:
        blobName - A String representing the name of the blob.
        Returns:
        A new BlockBlobAsyncClient object which references the blob with the specified name in this container.

                                                    java.lang.String snapshot)

Or, call this package's NewBlockBlobAsyncClient instead of calling this object's NewBlockBlobAsyncClient method.
        Parameters:
        blobName - A String representing the name of the blob.
        snapshot - the snapshot identifier for the blob.
        Returns:
        A new BlockBlobAsyncClient object which references the blob with the specified name in this container.

      • create

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<VoidResponse> create()
        Creates a new container within a storage account. If a container with the same name already exists, the operation fails. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Returns:
        A reactive response signalling completion.

      • create

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<VoidResponse> create(Metadata metadata,
                                                        PublicAccessType accessType)
        Creates a new container within a storage account. If a container with the same name already exists, the operation fails. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Parameters:
        metadata - Metadata
        accessType - Specifies how the data in this container is available to the public. See the x-ms-blob-public-access header in the Azure Docs for more information. Pass null for no public access.
        Returns:
        A reactive response signalling completion.

      • delete

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<VoidResponse> delete()
        Marks the specified container for deletion. The container and any blobs contained within it are later deleted during garbage collection. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Returns:
        A reactive response signalling completion.

      • delete

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<VoidResponse> delete(ContainerAccessConditions accessConditions)
        Marks the specified container for deletion. The container and any blobs contained within it are later deleted during garbage collection. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Parameters:
        accessConditions - ContainerAccessConditions
        Returns:
        A reactive response signalling completion.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If ContainerAccessConditions.modifiedAccessConditions() has either ModifiedAccessConditions.ifMatch() or ModifiedAccessConditions.ifNoneMatch() set.

      • getAccessPolicy

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<ContainerAccessPolicies>> getAccessPolicy()
        Returns the container's permissions. The permissions indicate whether container's blobs may be accessed publicly. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Returns:
        A reactive response containing the container access policy.

      • getAccessPolicy

        Parameters:
        leaseAccessConditions - By setting lease access conditions, requests will fail if the provided lease does not match the active lease on the blob.

      • setAccessPolicy

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<VoidResponse> setAccessPolicy(PublicAccessType accessType,
                                                                 java.util.List<SignedIdentifier> identifiers)
        Sets the container's permissions. The permissions indicate whether blobs in a container may be accessed publicly. Note that, for each signed identifier, we will truncate the start and expiry times to the nearest second to ensure the time formatting is compatible with the service. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Parameters:
        accessType - Specifies how the data in this container is available to the public. See the x-ms-blob-public-access header in the Azure Docs for more information. Pass null for no public access.
        identifiers - A list of SignedIdentifier objects that specify the permissions for the container. Please see here for more information. Passing null will clear all access policies.
        Returns:
        A reactive response signalling completion.

      • setAccessPolicy

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<VoidResponse> setAccessPolicy(PublicAccessType accessType,
                                                                 java.util.List<SignedIdentifier> identifiers,
                                                                 ContainerAccessConditions accessConditions)
        Sets the container's permissions. The permissions indicate whether blobs in a container may be accessed publicly. Note that, for each signed identifier, we will truncate the start and expiry times to the nearest second to ensure the time formatting is compatible with the service. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Parameters:
        accessType - Specifies how the data in this container is available to the public. See the x-ms-blob-public-access header in the Azure Docs for more information. Pass null for no public access.
        identifiers - A list of SignedIdentifier objects that specify the permissions for the container. Please see here for more information. Passing null will clear all access policies.
        accessConditions - ContainerAccessConditions
        Returns:
        A reactive response signalling completion.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If ContainerAccessConditions.modifiedAccessConditions() has either ModifiedAccessConditions.ifMatch() or ModifiedAccessConditions.ifNoneMatch() set.

      • listBlobsFlat

        public reactor.core.publisher.Flux<BlobItem> listBlobsFlat()
        Returns a reactive Publisher emitting all the blobs in this container lazily as needed. The directories are flattened and only actual blobs and no directories are returned.

        Blob names are returned in lexicographic order. For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        E.g. listing a container containing a 'foo' folder, which contains blobs 'foo1' and 'foo2', and a blob on the root level 'bar', will return

        • foo/foo1
        • foo/foo2
        • bar
        Returns:
        A reactive response emitting the flattened blobs.

      • listBlobsFlat

        public reactor.core.publisher.Flux<BlobItem> listBlobsFlat(ListBlobsOptions options)
        Returns a reactive Publisher emitting all the blobs in this container lazily as needed. The directories are flattened and only actual blobs and no directories are returned.

        Blob names are returned in lexicographic order. For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        E.g. listing a container containing a 'foo' folder, which contains blobs 'foo1' and 'foo2', and a blob on the root level 'bar', will return

        • foo/foo1
        • foo/foo2
        • bar
        Parameters:
        options - ListBlobsOptions
        Returns:
        A reactive response emitting the listed blobs, flattened.

      • listBlobsHierarchy

        public reactor.core.publisher.Flux<BlobItem> listBlobsHierarchy(java.lang.String directory)
        Returns a reactive Publisher emitting all the blobs and directories (prefixes) under the given directory (prefix). Directories will have BlobItem.isPrefix() set to true.

        Blob names are returned in lexicographic order. For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        E.g. listing a container containing a 'foo' folder, which contains blobs 'foo1' and 'foo2', and a blob on the root level 'bar', will return the following results when prefix=null:

        • foo/ (isPrefix = true)
        • bar (isPrefix = false)

        will return the following results when prefix="foo/":

        • foo/foo1 (isPrefix = false)
        • foo/foo2 (isPrefix = false)
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory to list blobs underneath
        Returns:
        A reactive response emitting the prefixes and blobs.

      • listBlobsHierarchy

        public reactor.core.publisher.Flux<BlobItem> listBlobsHierarchy(java.lang.String delimiter,
                                                                ListBlobsOptions options)
        Returns a reactive Publisher emitting all the blobs and prefixes (directories) under the given prefix (directory). Directories will have BlobItem.isPrefix() set to true.

        Blob names are returned in lexicographic order. For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        E.g. listing a container containing a 'foo' folder, which contains blobs 'foo1' and 'foo2', and a blob on the root level 'bar', will return the following results when prefix=null:

        • foo/ (isPrefix = true)
        • bar (isPrefix = false)

        will return the following results when prefix="foo/":

        • foo/foo1 (isPrefix = false)
        • foo/foo2 (isPrefix = false)
        Parameters:
        delimiter - The delimiter for blob hierarchy, "/" for hierarchy based on directories
        options - ListBlobsOptions
        Returns:
        A reactive response emitting the prefixes and blobs.

      • acquireLease

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<java.lang.String>> acquireLease(java.lang.String proposedId,
                                                                            int duration)
        Acquires a lease on the blob for write and delete operations. The lease duration must be between 15 to 60 seconds, or infinite (-1).
        Parameters:
        proposedId - A String in any valid GUID format. May be null.
        duration - The duration of the lease, in seconds, or negative one (-1) for a lease that never expires. A non-infinite lease can be between 15 and 60 seconds.
        Returns:
        A reactive response containing the lease ID.

      • acquireLease

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<java.lang.String>> acquireLease(java.lang.String proposedID,
                                                                            int duration,
                                                                            ModifiedAccessConditions modifiedAccessConditions)
        Acquires a lease on the blob for write and delete operations. The lease duration must be between 15 to 60 seconds, or infinite (-1).
        Parameters:
        proposedID - A String in any valid GUID format. May be null.
        duration - The duration of the lease, in seconds, or negative one (-1) for a lease that never expires. A non-infinite lease can be between 15 and 60 seconds.
        modifiedAccessConditions - Standard HTTP Access conditions related to the modification of data. ETag and LastModifiedTime are used to construct conditions related to when the blob was changed relative to the given request. The request will fail if the specified condition is not satisfied.
        Returns:
        A reactive response containing the lease ID.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If either ModifiedAccessConditions.ifMatch() or ModifiedAccessConditions.ifNoneMatch() is set.

      • renewLease

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<java.lang.String>> renewLease(java.lang.String leaseID)
        Renews the blob's previously-acquired lease.
        Parameters:
        leaseID - The leaseId of the active lease on the blob.
        Returns:
        A reactive response containing the renewed lease ID.

      • renewLease

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<java.lang.String>> renewLease(java.lang.String leaseID,
                                                                          ModifiedAccessConditions modifiedAccessConditions)
        Renews the blob's previously-acquired lease.
        Parameters:
        leaseID - The leaseId of the active lease on the blob.
        modifiedAccessConditions - Standard HTTP Access conditions related to the modification of data. ETag and LastModifiedTime are used to construct conditions related to when the blob was changed relative to the given request. The request will fail if the specified condition is not satisfied.
        Returns:
        A reactive response containing the renewed lease ID.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If either ModifiedAccessConditions.ifMatch() or ModifiedAccessConditions.ifNoneMatch() is set.

      • releaseLease

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<VoidResponse> releaseLease(java.lang.String leaseID)
        Releases the blob's previously-acquired lease.
        Parameters:
        leaseID - The leaseId of the active lease on the blob.
        Returns:
        A reactive response signalling completion.

      • releaseLease

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<VoidResponse> releaseLease(java.lang.String leaseID,
                                                              ModifiedAccessConditions modifiedAccessConditions)
        Releases the blob's previously-acquired lease.
        Parameters:
        leaseID - The leaseId of the active lease on the blob.
        modifiedAccessConditions - Standard HTTP Access conditions related to the modification of data. ETag and LastModifiedTime are used to construct conditions related to when the blob was changed relative to the given request. The request will fail if the specified condition is not satisfied.
        Returns:
        A reactive response signalling completion.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If either ModifiedAccessConditions.ifMatch() or ModifiedAccessConditions.ifNoneMatch() is set.

      • breakLease

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<java.time.Duration>> breakLease()
        BreakLease breaks the blob's previously-acquired lease (if it exists). Pass the LeaseBreakDefault (-1) constant to break a fixed-duration lease when it expires or an infinite lease immediately.
        Returns:
        A reactive response containing the remaining time in the broken lease.

      • breakLease

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<java.time.Duration>> breakLease(java.lang.Integer breakPeriodInSeconds,
                                                                            ModifiedAccessConditions modifiedAccessConditions)
        BreakLease breaks the blob's previously-acquired lease (if it exists). Pass the LeaseBreakDefault (-1) constant to break a fixed-duration lease when it expires or an infinite lease immediately.
        Parameters:
        breakPeriodInSeconds - An optional Integer representing the proposed duration of seconds that the lease should continue before it is broken, between 0 and 60 seconds. This break period is only used if it is shorter than the time remaining on the lease. If longer, the time remaining on the lease is used. A new lease will not be available before the break period has expired, but the lease may be held for longer than the break period.
        modifiedAccessConditions - Standard HTTP Access conditions related to the modification of data. ETag and LastModifiedTime are used to construct conditions related to when the blob was changed relative to the given request. The request will fail if the specified condition is not satisfied.
        Returns:
        A reactive response containing the remaining time in the broken lease.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If either ModifiedAccessConditions.ifMatch() or ModifiedAccessConditions.ifNoneMatch() is set.

      • changeLease

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<java.lang.String>> changeLease(java.lang.String leaseId,
                                                                           java.lang.String proposedID)
        ChangeLease changes the blob's lease ID.
        Parameters:
        leaseId - The leaseId of the active lease on the blob.
        proposedID - A String in any valid GUID format.
        Returns:
        A reactive response containing the new lease ID.

      • changeLease

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<java.lang.String>> changeLease(java.lang.String leaseId,
                                                                           java.lang.String proposedID,
                                                                           ModifiedAccessConditions modifiedAccessConditions)
        ChangeLease changes the blob's lease ID. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Parameters:
        leaseId - The leaseId of the active lease on the blob.
        proposedID - A String in any valid GUID format.
        modifiedAccessConditions - Standard HTTP Access conditions related to the modification of data. ETag and LastModifiedTime are used to construct conditions related to when the blob was changed relative to the given request. The request will fail if the specified condition is not satisfied.
        Returns:
        A reactive response containing the new lease ID.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If either ModifiedAccessConditions.ifMatch() or ModifiedAccessConditions.ifNoneMatch() is set.

      • getAccountInfo

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<StorageAccountInfo>> getAccountInfo()
        Returns the sku name and account kind for the account. For more information, please see the Azure Docs.
        Returns:
        A reactive response containing the account info.

      • generateUserDelegationSAS

        public java.lang.String generateUserDelegationSAS(UserDelegationKey userDelegationKey,
